ACT
61
Duties of the executor of the will
If the testator has not specified otherwise, it is the duty of the executor of the will, in particular, to take care and undertake what is necessary for the preservation of the estate, to manage it, on behalf and for the account of the heir, to undertake what is necessary for payment in the name and on behalf of the heir debts and records, making sure in every respect that the will is executed as the testator wanted it.
The court shall issue to the executor of the will, at his request, a certificate of his capacity and powers without delay, with an instruction to everyone that the executor's statements are to be taken as if they were those of the testator. Whoever acts in good faith according to the declaration of a person who has declared himself executor of the will with a court certificate, is not responsible for the damage that would result from this for the heirs.
If there are several executors of the will, they perform the duties entrusted to them together, unless the testator has determined otherwise.
If the executors of the will cannot agree on the performance of their duties, the court, ex officio or at the request of one of them or the heirs, will determine the actions to be taken and authorize one of the executors to undertake them.
